Articles.Content: Thank you for all of your support! Have A great day!

This is absolutely awesome Vaos! The video alone is fantastic and the SSTO is so glorious! I will use your excellent Rapier tip too.

 It is great to see you posting craft here man.
I might just have to give this a fly!! Way to hit the ball outta the park again Vaos!!
Super great information being shared here, really nice work Vaos!

Great video!

I'm going to try tweaking my stuff to drop some TWR based on your results.  I'm really surprised those wing parts held together on reentry!
Great video.  Entertaining and informative.

"Too Much Thrust"

BLASPHEMY!

Edited March 1, 2016 by Heckspress

Pretty cool bird! I am glad that my TWR comments (and those of others, by the sound of it) sunk in.

I haven't tried it myself, but it does look quite similar to my heaviest bird (and workhorse of the fleet), the Claymore. Same powerplant, same payload, slightly bigger bay and a few crewmembers bolted on top (I'm usually volume-limited, and an engineer on hand to help with KAS-related stuff is useful). So I can very comfortably say: "it's almost exactly what I would have done". Ok, maybe the wings have low temp. rating, but other than that...

 

Rune.  BTW, that is totally intended as a compliment.

Edited March 1, 2016 by Rune

Welcome to the forums!

Nice to see you posting here, Vaos.

The latest iteration of your Jupiter Star is truly amazing. Awesome looking craft that are efficient too are not seen often. Well done!
Outstanding, I learned a lot here--thanks!

Excellent video.

Thank you.

Happy landings!

@Vaos Human I am incredibly impressed at not only the Jupiter Star, but that video as well.  The camera shots were well crafted, the music was great (the new Star Trek ), and the voice-over description was really interesting of how the evolution of this spaceplane has progressed.  At the risk of repeating some of the previous replies, you should post in the forums more often.

Ever since 0.90, I've struggled several times to resurrect my "Pegasus" Mk3 SSTO with little success, but you've motivated me to try again.  As someone that appreciates craft that manage functionality and aesthetics, I gotta say that Jupiter Star Mk17 is very cool-looking.

@Vaos Human, and anyone else who was wondering... Yes, it can survive a water landing.

I completely overshot the runway coming down. I should have made my descent a bit steeper, like lowering my periapsis to 55km instead of just 60km. I tried for the island to the northwest of KSC, but it looked to quite hilly from what I could see. So I figured "F(*truck horn*) it, emergency water landing it is."

Needless to say, it "boats" quite well.
